Present at least 2 Choices
A choice isn't a choice when there isn't options to choose from. A single Choice is a
confusing UX pattern, as it's not clear what the user is meant to do, even if that single
Choice was automatically pre-selected. Consider showing single Choices as static
content on the screen, including it as part of the information of a previous Choice, or
showing disabled or unavailable Choices alongside the one available Choice.

Keep the information concise
Information to make a choice should be short and simple. If there is more information
to help the user make a decision, consider placing it nearby alongside the choice group.

Extending the choice selection language
While the Choice component contains a limited selection of layout variants, you may
want to explore creating your own custom choice components. Please be aware of the
margins of the Choice component and follow the SKAPA visual language for Choice. The
Choice component contains a variant for custom content.
